django-homecontrol

Models¶

class app.models.Door(*args, **kwargs)¶

Door model.

This model contains the specifications for a door that leads into a room. Main goal of this model is to give controls to lock/unlock the door itself.

class app.models.Home(*args, **kwargs)¶

Home model. Includes all devices that can be controlled.

This model contains the relationships between the different types of devices that can be controlled in the app. Each house is instantiated uniquely. A house can have an owner.

save(**kwargs)¶

Custom save method to create random secret key

class app.models.Light(*args, **kwargs)¶

Light model.

This model contains the specifications for the type of light the user would like to add. Defaults to binary mode. Many lights per room.

class app.models.Refrigerator(*args, **kwargs)¶

Refrigerator model.

This model exposes the refrigerator to the home control. It is designed to read and write fridge/freezer temperature.

class app.models.Room(*args, **kwargs)¶

Room model.

Abstraction of a group of devices grouped into a single class. User can specify a name for a room and define actions based on room type. Many rooms per home.

class app.models.Thermostat(*args, **kwargs)¶

Nest-like thermostat model.

This model is designed to act like a Nest thermostat in the home. Its main purpose is to report and set thermostat temperature. One thermostat per home. User specifies if thermostat controls AC and/or heater.
